title: Elton John reveals Rod Stewart savagely dumped lovers by leaving plane ticket on bed
text:

Musical icon Sir Elton John has made some revelations about fellow superstar Rod Stewart in his new memoirs.

In an excerpt from Me: Elton John, published by the Daily Mail , Elton dishes that the Maggie May hitmaker would leave a plane ticket on the bed after sleeping with women.

Elton writes about his own love life, dishing that he struggled with emotional relationships and that he'd "end up getting bored" of people he'd very recently fallen in love with.

He writes: "It was absolutely dreadful behaviour: I'd be having one leaving at the airport at the same time as the new one was flying in.

"It was a decadent era, and plenty of other pop stars were behaving in a similar way - Rod Stewart occasionally let girls know he'd finished with them by just leaving a plane ticket on their bed, so he wasn't going to win any awards for chivalry either."

(Image: Getty)

(Image: Getty Images)

Father of eight Rod recently divulged the secret to success in his marriage to Loose Women panelist Penny Lancaster.

The 74 year-old said: "Penny and I like our silence. We live in a very big house and we don't bump into each other for hours on end."

Elton, now 72, also revealed his struggle with mental health - he even tried to take his own life.

He had been "insecure and body-conscious and self-loathing", and this led to his suicide attempt.

He says: "One night, while I was recording with the new band up at Caribou Studios, I took an overdose of Valium before I went to bed. Twelve tablets.

"I can't remember what exactly prompted me to do that, although it was probably some catastrophic love affair gone wrong."

Later, Elton details a stint in rehab during the early Nineties and how it was brought about by a struggling relationship with a man named Hugh.

(Image: PA)

(Image: Getty Images)

"I called Hugh," Elton writes, "who agreed to meet, but only in the presence of his counsellor.

"The next day, I was in a tiny motel room in America, facing Hugh. The counsellor had told us both to make a list of things we didn't like about each other and then read it out.

"I went first.

(Image: WireImage)

(Image: Getty Images for EJAF)

"I said that I didn't like the fact that Hugh was untidy. He left his clothes everywhere, and didn't put CDs back in their cases.

"Then it was Hugh's turn. I noticed he was shaking. 'You're a drug addict,' he said. 'You're an alcoholic. You're a food addict and a bulimic. You're a sex addict. You're co-dependent.'

"There was a long pause. He clearly thought I was going to explode again.

"'Yes,' I said, 'Yes, I am.'"

Later, Elton continues that being treated for three addictions wasn't so simple.

"Getting help wasn't straightforward, as I needed to be treated for three addictions at once: cocaine, alcohol and food. On July 29, 1990, I ended up in the only place I could find that would take me - an ordinary general hospital in Chicago, with a view over a shopping-centre car park.

"A consultant asked me how I was feeling, and I told him the truth: I didn't know.

"I wasn't sure if I'd had any real feelings for years, or whether everything was the result of the constant see-sawing of emotions brought on by drugs and booze."

*Me: Elton John is published on October 15
description: Sir Elton's shocking new memoirs delve into the activities of his generation's music legends, including Rod Stewart's love life
